div.l: Of corne be sleight ne bi force hem reve
And at the laste the wardene yaf hem leve
Iohn hight the tone and Aleyn hight the tothere
AleynOf oone towne weren they borne that hight Strothere
Ferr͗e in the northe I can not telle where
This Aleyn maketh redy all his gere
And on a hors the sak he caste anoone
Forthe gothe Aleyn the clerke and also Iohn
With good swerde and bucklere by her Syde
Iohn knewe the way hym nedeth no gyde
And at the mylle the sak a doun̄ they laye
Aleyn spake firste alhayle Symkyn in faye
Howe fares thy faire doughter and thy wyff
Aleyn welcome qduod Symkyn be my lif
And Iohn also what nowe do ye here
Be god qduod Iohn Symkyn nede hath no pere
Hym falleth to ʆserue hem self that hath no sweyn
Or elles he is a fonne as clerkes seyn̄
Oure mauncyple as I hope wil be dede
So werketh ay the vaynes in his hede
And therfore am I come and eke aleyn̄
To grynde oure corne and Carye it home ageyn̄
I pray you spede vs in all that ye may
It shall be done qduod Symkyn be my fay
What wil ye do whiles it is in hande
God wote right bi the hopper wil I stonde
Qduod Iohn and se howe the corne gothe Inn̄
Yete sawe I neủer be my Fader kynne
Howe that the hoppere waggeth to and froo
Aleyn answerde and wilte thou so
Than wil I benethe be my Crown̄
And se howe that the mele falleth doun̄
Into the troughe that shall be my disporte
For Iohn in faithe I may be of youre sorte
For I am as Evyll a myln̉er as ye
This myln̉er smyleth for her nycite
And thought all this is done for a wile
They wene that no man may hem begyle
But be my thrifte yite wil I bere her Eye
For all her sleight and her philosophye
The more quoynte knakkes that they make
The more wil I stele when I take
In stede of mele yite wil I yeue hem brenne
